Gocha requested a loan from Credo to start up a business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Gocha will purchase a car and equipment for natural gas installation. He will be able to get orders and install natural gas in families' homes. He hopes his project will be profitable and the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and equipment for providing natural gas installation services.

loans.name: Leri

texts.en:
Leri is 63 years old. He lives in the Baghdati District with his wife. Leri requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have six milk cows and a pig. Besides, Leri has a vineyard. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Leri requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Leri will build a mill. After building the mill, he will serve the local farmers and grind cereals. He will get fees and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a mill

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jerry and the mother of her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gina retails processed meat products. What she basically does is buy processed meat products from wholesalers and then she sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Products can range from ham, hotdogs, processed pork and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of supplies of frozen foods to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gina hopes to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies of frozen foods needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Salome

texts.en:
Ma. Salome is 43 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Salome works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of canned goods, feed, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ma. Salome has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from wholesaling feed and other veterinary products.

Ma. Salome aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of canned goods, animal feed, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Janetria

texts.en:
Janetria is 44 years old, married, and has five children. She started her business selling women's clothes four years ago. She sells her merchandise from her home since she has a store next to her kitchen. 

Janetria's husband is a security officer and out of their combined income, they plan to build a house of their own since they rent the house where they currently live. 

At the present time, Janetria needs money in order to buy new things to sell. For these purchases, she would like Ksh 20,000. Jenetria's customers are very satisfied and think of her as a scrupulous and honest woman.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of 12 children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income. Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy  new fishing nets, fish hooks and lead weights. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Elizabeth has hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her younger children.

loans.use: to buy  new fishing nets, fish hooks and lead weights

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell for her business.

Lolita has been in this business for 12 years. Lolita earns more income from raising pigs.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Armando Rigoberto

texts.es:
Armando tiene 29 años de edad. Vive en Unión Libre junto a su esposa y a sus hijos. En el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Armando  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprarse un carro para el trabajo t un solar para hacer la casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte y descansar.
texts.en:
Armando is 29 years old. He lives with his common-law wife and their children in the Ventana Canton in the Los Rios Province. He has two children. 

The members of the ‘Jesús Nos Ama’ [Jesus Loves Us] communal bank are located in the Los Amarillos community in the Ventanas Canton. This group is dedicated to short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, and beans. They have been engaged in this business activity for a long time. 

Armando is a farmer, and he grows corn, rice, and cocoa.  He purchases his products in Agripac Eicopa, and he carries out his sales at the fair in Ventanas. 

He requests a loan to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers that he needs to plant corn, rice, and cocoa. With this loan he will have the financial support to provide for his needs.  He faces difficulties such as pest infestations, disease, and the changing weather. 

His dream is to buy a car for his work and a plot of land upon which to build his house.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.

loans.name: Namig

texts.en:
Namig, 48, is married. He lives with his two beloved children and his wife, who are his main priority.

He mainly sells milk products: cheese, butter, yogurt, and also meat. With his loan, he will buy a breeding cow. This will increase the number of animals and accordingly, with these improvements to his pasture, he hopes to get more income and improve his family's living conditions and self-improvement. 

Namig is a very hardworking man who does his best for his family. He also works as a driver of a micro-bus, driving the people to destinations, and earns approximately 300 AZN there.

loans.use: to buy a breeding cow.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 60 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Francisca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Francisca has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Munkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbold, 47 years old, lives with his family in Dornod, an eastern province of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

In October, 2012 he started working as a security officer at a wrestling stadium. His wife gets a disability pension from the state, and his son works in the construction field. His daughter works as an assistant at a sausage factory. 

As his son became an adult and got married, it become necessary to live separately from his parents in another house. So beginning last summer, father and son began building a house, but due to lack of financing, they haven’t finished the building work. Therefore, Munkhbold is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase construction materials. 

As a result, his son can live with his own family at his own house without living in his father’s home. The borrower is a very hardworking person who strives for his children’s better future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a house for his newly married son.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 51 years old and widowed with two children.

Carmelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Carmelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Biruta

texts.en:
Biruta is 54 years old. She works at a local library of the district where she lives. Her husband works at a gas-filling organization and earns there 400 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). They have three children. 

Nineteen years ago, to support her family and help her husband, Biruta started an agriculture business. She runs her business well, each year increasing the number of sheep.

Biruta requested a loan from VFAC to buy more sheep. The income helps her to keep the business stable.
 
They have an unfinished house under construction. Her business is relied upon by the family, and depending on her income, she plans to finish building work on the house.

loans.use: To buy more sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet for his tenants.

loans.name: Ochirsuren

texts.en:
Ochirsuren, 46 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His elder daughter and son study at university, at third and first grade, respectively. His other two children are four and two years old and stay at home. His wife works as an accountant at an organization which protects residents' rights. 

From 1988 to 1990, Ochirsuren worked as a service man. Two years later, he worked as a bus driver until 1996 and soon began his own transportation service. 

The microvan Ochirsuren uses for transportation has deteriorated over the years, so he is in need of repairing it or purchasing a new one. Purchasing a new one is more beneficial since a repaired microvan has a high possibility of breaking down again. So, he is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to purchase a new microvan. 

As a result, the family can generate more income, which will improve their living standard. Also, Ochirsuren can work enthusiastically, without worrying about his microvan's stable operation.

loans.use: to purchase a new microvan for his transportation business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Lolita is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and other items. With this loan, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Lolita has hopes of making their business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and other items.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, 47, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolly, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luzviminda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luzviminda dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a good life with her family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Genelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Genelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta raises her four children through her source of income, selling grocery items in their village. She started her business by vending vegetables and meat around their village. She strives to run her business and save some of her profit. When she has enough savings, it will serve as her starting capital to build her sari-sari business. 

Enriqueta is also a dealer of soft drinks in some villages near her house. Enriqueta wants to extend the business in the other municipalities, that’s why she decided to borrow a loan of PHP 30,000. She plans to use the loan to buy beverages and sell them in some villages in other municipalities. Enriqueta will run the business well for the continued growth of it.

loans.use: to buy beverages and sell them.

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en:
Tharcisse is 61 years old. He is married with seven children, and they all go to school. His wife is also a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 40 years. He has requested this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and quality seeds and to support labor costs during rice production. With the profits from the harvest, he will be for paying school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and quality seeds and to support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Melba Priscila

texts.es:
MELBA PRISCILA tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene una hija, vive con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es Integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Pechiche Reciunto Anchoveta, pertenece al Cantòn Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrìcolas, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

MELBA PRISCILA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas,fertilizantes, semillas, ranger, una bomba. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para poder sembrar, la bomba para fumigar los sembríos.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas . El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas, enfermedades en las siembras y la competencia.
El sueño es comprar terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los animales.
texts.en:
Melba Priscila is 33 years old, single and has one daughter. She lives with her daughter in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. 

She is a member of the Anchoveta Communal Bank, located in the Pechiche Reciunto Anchoveta parish. The parish belongs to canton Pueblo Viejo, and works in farm work and livestock.

Melba Priscila works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. She is asking for a loan to buy urea, pesticides, fertilizer, seeds, Ranger (herbicide), and a pump. With help from the loan, she will be able to buy what is necessary to plant seeds, and with the pump she will fumigate the sown fields.

She will buy and sell in Ventanas. The challenges that she faces are pests, crop disease, and competition. Her dream is to buy land. In her free time she likes to take care of animals.

loans.use: to buy urea, pesticides, fertilizer, seeds, Ranger (herbicide), and a pump

loans.name: Shinebayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Shinebayar, 28 years old, lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She learned Vietnamese by befriending Vietnamese students, and it helped her to work as a manager in Vietnamese-invested company. 

By 2005, she had worked there for five years, and in 2010, she opened her own auto repair shop; it has been operating quite well over the last few years. 

Her daughter is only five years old, and she lives with her in an apartment, along with her two Vietnamese workers. 

In order to expand her business, she is hiring one more person from Vietnam, and needs several necessary pieces of equipment. So she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase some necessary items such as paints, mastics and equipment.

As a result, she can generate more income, and can invest in her little daughter’s future needs.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment, paints, and mastic for her auto repair shop.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
The selling of snack foods, fruits, and vegetables is Florida's business. This is her way of gaining income to sustain her two children, daily allowances, and her family's daily food. She has run this business in her village for 15 years. Florida dreams to have her own restaurant business. She is continuing to manage her business well, to improve it, to increase her income, and to be able to make her dream a reality. 

Florida wishes for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy grocery items like canned goods, soft drinks, and breads. Florida hopes that, through her loan, she will increase her income for her family's better future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned goods, soft drinks, and breads for her business.

loans.name: Hyacenthe

texts.en:
Hyacenthe is aged 33. She is married to a farmer. She has been farming for 15 years. She wants to use the loan for purchasing fertilizers, quality seeds, and to support labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and quality seeds; and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of five children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for some time now in her place, selling various goods and commodities.

Eunice is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell in her store like canned goods, snack foods, cooking ingredients, beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store thus increasing her sales and profit.

In the future, Eunice  dreams of making her business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store like canned goods, snack foods, cooking ingredients, beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 31; he is married to a farmer, and he has been a rice farmer for 15 years. 

He has requested this Kiva Loan to buy fertilizer, quality seeds, and support labor costs during maize production. With the profits from the harvest, he will be paying school fees for the children, and building a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, quality seeds, and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 56 years old. He is married to a farmer, and he has been a rice farmer for 13 years. 

He has requested this Kiva Loan to buy fertilizer, quality seeds, and support labor costs during maize production. With the profits from the harvest, he will be paying school fees for the children, and buy cattle for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and to pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab, 30, is a young married woman living in a rental house with her husband and one daughter. She lives in the suburban area of Kisauni, Coast Province. She has been selling snacks and fast food for five months. Her food stand is located along a busy street. She has established a good clientele base who prefer her because of her kindness, good service, variety of snacks and good environment. Rahab is noted for being an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.

She is asking for a 25,000 KES loan to buy flour, rice, cooking fat, vegetables, meat and charcoal. With support from this loan she intends to meet the financial needs of her business while improving her income at the same time. Her dream is to improve the business even more and to one day own a house.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, cooking fat, vegetables, meat and charcoal.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 42 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He has requested this Kiva Loan to buy fertilizers and quality seeds and to support labor costs during maize production. With the profits from the harvest, Theogene will be paying for school fees for the children and buying a car which can help him with transportation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank of Rwanda is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and quality seeds and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a small business owner who runs a beauty salon. Before starting her own business, Eunice used to work in a beauty salon, which allowed her to gain lots of experience and build her clientele. Once she set up her own salon, her former customers started to frequent it. They are very satisfied with the services that she provides because she attends to them with professionalism and uses well-known products.

Eunice will use this loan in order to purchase various products so that she can restock her business and meet customer demand.

Her business has grown noticeably, and she feels happy because everything is turning out well.

loans.use: to purchase such items as shampoo, lotions, weavers, and blow dryers

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat, age 56, is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter to appear in the photo. Najat's husband is a car painter. Their daughter Sondos, age 18, is attending the university to study biology. 

Sondos is in her first year at the university and looking forward to earning her Bachelor's degree. Najat has applied for this loan in order to help her daughter in her studies and to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's next semester fees.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She owns a clothes shop, from where she sells clothes and bags. Michelle is single mother of one child. 

The business has been supporting Michelle and her family for the last two years. Michelle is applying for a loan of 53,800 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothes, bags, sandals, etc. for sale at her business. The extra income from this business will help her pay for her child’s school fees.

Her ambition is to grow the business into a fully stocked boutique.  The challenges in the business are a seasonal business climate, finding more customers and lack of capital, a problem she sees partly sorted.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes, bags, sandals, etc. for sale at her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth used her previous loan to purchase a dairy cow for efficient milk production. As a result, her monthly income increased to KES 25,000. 

Elizabeth is now taking out a loan of KES 60,000 to maize for resale as she wants to expand to another type of business. She plans to reinvest the anticipated profit in the business.

loans.use: to purchase maize for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is the 32-year-old mother of a 5-year-old son who is currently attending school. She is married to Kassim, and together they contribute to the household expenses. 

Amina has owned a private school for the last two years, which is located in a busy trading center. She wants to add more classrooms due to the increasing number of pupils every year. With this loan she is requesting from Yehu, she plans to buy building materials such as cement, timbers, sand, iron sheets, etc. She is optimistic that her school will expand to become a well known high school in the future.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, timbers, sand, iron sheets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for an electrical repairs business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replace the body of the auto-rickshaw used for transport services

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal, is a 49-year-old, hard-working woman. She is a mother of five sons. 

Fourteen years ago, Amal started her tailoring business at home, on a small scale. Through the years, she managed to expand and open her own workshop. Now, Amal has applied for this loan to buy some fabric and better quality threads, to improve her service. In the future, Amal wants to start employing tailors to help expand the business more.

loans.use: to buy some fabric and better quality threads for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh is 49 years old. He is the father of two boys and one girl. Saleh has a drinks kiosk, where he sells both hot and cold drinks. He changes the drinks and snacks he offers with them based on the season. Now Saleh has applied to a loan to introduce a new kind of Arabic coffee to his menu.

loans.use: to purchase a new kind of Arabic coffee for his business.

loans.name: Mery Janeth

texts.es:
MERY JANETH tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es Integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Pechiche Reciunto Anchoveta, pertenece al Cantòn Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrìcolas, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

MERY JANETH se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, ranger, una bomba. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba para fumigar los sembríos.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas . El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plgas y enfermedades en las plantaciones.

El sueño es comprar terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar al hijo.
texts.en:
Mery Janeth, age 40, is single and has one child.  She lives with her son in the City of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

She is a member of the Anchoveta communal bank, located in the Pechiche Reciunta Anchoveta parrish, Canton Pueblo Viejo.  They do agriculture and livestock related work here. 

Mery Janeth works in agriculture growing corn and rice. She requests a loan to buy urea, seeds, herbicide and a pump. With the help from the loan she will be able to buy fertilizer and a pump to fumigate her crops. 

She will make her purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. The challenges she faces are pest infestations and diseases in the crops. 

Her dream is to buy land. During her free time she likes taking care of her son.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, herbicide and a pump.

loans.name: Fanice

texts.en:
Fanice is 51 years old and married with five children aged 22, 21, 20, 19 and 13 years respectively. She runs a fruits and food vending business which has been operational for the last 11 years, and which also earns her a monthly income of about Kshs 30,000.

She is borrowing a loan of Kshs 30,000, with which she plans to purchase bananas, soda and cakes for resale to her clients. 

Her dream is to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To add more stock of fruits to her shop.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 49-year-old man. He and his wife Nancy are blessed with four children. He is a taxi driver in Ruaka in Kiambu and he has been in the business for 3 years, earning a monthly income of 100,000 Kenya shillings (KES).
 
This will be his fourth loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the entire loan to repair his vehicle and have it serviced. He would like to use the anticipated profits to save towards the purchase of another vehicle. In future he wants to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: to take the taxi for repairs and service.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is taking out another loan from Kiva, this being her second Kiva loan but fifth loan with Yehu. She narrates that she is doing well since she started getting this assistance. With the previous Yehu loans, she was able to open a retail shop. Thanks to the support of her Kiva loan which opened the door for more success in business, she was able to venture into her soft drink business. With this new loan, she will be able to add stock of foodstuffs, basic grains, cleaning products and instant goods.

loans.use: to add stock of foodstuffs, basic grains, cleaning products and instant goods.

loans.name: Khader

texts.en: Khader, is a 48 year-old-man. He asked his son to appear in the photo for security reasons, because of his work. Khader is a father of six sons and daughters, his oldest is Mohammad, a 21-year-old university student. He is majoring in Managerial Information Systems. Khader has applied for this loan to pay for his son’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s semester fees.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is a 28-year-old mother of one daughter. She is a talented woman who opened a small workshop for making mosaic art. Ghada takes orders to make different sizes of art mosaics. Now, she has applied for a youth loan to buy a new cutter machine and some new tools.

loans.use: to buy a new cutter machine and some new tools for her art workshop.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hisham is 33 years old. He is the father of two girls and a boy. Hisham is a barber who wants to improve his barber shop in order to increase his profits. He has applied for a loan to add another seat and to make new decorations in his shop.

loans.use: to add another seat and to add decorations in his barber shop.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: La Sra. Hortencia tiene 31 años,  tiene dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 4 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de venta de condimentos y especias para sazonar las comidas,  su tienda se encuentra ubicado en la zona del  Plan 3000, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Hortencia utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de una moledora para moler comino y ajíes   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando productos. Su deseo por su negocio es que su tienda sea más grande y más surtida y así de esta manera incrementas su clientela y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en: Ms. Hortencia is 31 years old.  She has two children, ages 4 and 5.  She sells basic products in her store, especially condiments and spices to season food.  Her store is found in the Plan 3000 zone.  This loan is her first with the institution.  Ms. Hortencia will use the loan to buy a grinder to grind cumin and peppers.  She is requesting this loan because she needs to stock her store.  She is going to use the loan to keep buying products.  Her wish for her business is that her store will be the biggest and best stocked, and in this way, both her customers and earnings will increase.

loans.use: to buy a grinder to grind cumin and peppers

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en: Melvin is a simple business owner in the village of Lallo. He supports his family through retailing motor parts and spare parts for vehicles.  With over 10 years in this activity, he is doing his best to develop his business, especially increasing his income. Now, he is seeking additional working capital in the amount of PHP 30,000 to purchase a variety of spare parts such as rims and tires. He is hoping that through the loan he is accessing he can improve his business so that his family’s life style will also be enhanced. He could then also save for the good education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vehicle spare parts such as rims and tires

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is a 49-year-old widowed woman and a mother of two children. They live in Ubay, Bohol. Genoveva has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

Genoveva is asking for a loan  to buy more stock to sell like noodles, rice, canned goods, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and profit. 

In the future, Genoveva dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to support the schooling of her children so that they will become successful professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like noodles, rice, canned goods, sodas and other  beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en: Ahlam is a 37-year-old mother of two boys and two girls. She started a small business at home, selling baby pampers to help her husband in paying some household bills. Ahlam buys baby pampers in large quantities from the factories and a wholesales market and repacks them in smaller quantities to sell. Now, Ahlam has applied for a loan to buy more pampers and also some cleaning products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more pampers and cleaning products sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her kiosk.

loans.name: Yaiphabi Group

texts.en:
This group of 10 women is popularly known as “Yaiphabi Group”. They belong to a non-tribal community and live at the outskirts of Imphal East in a small village in Manipur state located in the North Eastern part of India. Taxi service is available but it takes about one hour drive to reach the place.

Chaoba is the profiled member pictured with raised hand. She is 40 years old and she is a mother to two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a hired lorry driver and the main earner of the family. Her three older children are school drop-outs and now her youngest daughter aged 14 years is the only member of the family going to school. Chaoba is determined to provide to her youngest daughter everything that she failed to give the older children. She is happy that every member of the family, too, supports the youngest daughter with the necessary requirements for her schooling. 

In order to supplement the family income, before the loans Chaoba used to earn money on anything that came her way. She even worked as a lorry labourer doing work such as loading and unloading sand and grindstones from the truck. In 2010, she joined the group to access loans and start a business activity of her own.

With her first loan she purchased 10 bags of unhulled rice and paid INR 450 per bag weighing 40 kilogram each. She would then process the rice at a rice mill to separate the husk from the grain and sell it for a profit. With the second loan, she was able to expand her business with better profit earning. Her elder son helps her with the business. Apart from meeting the loan liability, she managed to save around INR 500 on a monthly basis together with a savings group of 30 members.

She plans to purchase a sewing machine for her other daughter to enhance her embroidery art and also wishes to own one of those rice mills down the road for future income opportunity. For this she means to save as much as she can with the help of her family members.

She needs another loan now to continue with her rice-selling business. With limited capital she was not in a position to do the business on large scale. She will use the loan to buy unhulled rice and stock it to sell when rice is in demand for a higher profit.

Likewise, the rest of the group members too need a loan to continue and improve upon their respective income-generating activities. Vegetable vending, sand sieving (quarrying), poultry farming, and grocery store business are some of the activities that the members are engaged in.

loans.use: To buy bags of paddy rice, extract the grain from the husk, and sell it for a profit.

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
In 2010 these 12 Tribal women created a platform for themselves and formed a group called Ruth. They all reside in Saikul town in Manipur state which is in the North Eastern part of India. In this part of the state, people still struggle to have ways and means to earn their livelihood.

Hoineo is one of the 12 members and she is pictured with a raised hand. She is a mother to two sons and one daughter and she is 28 years old. She attended school up to the primary grades. She is happy that all her children go to a private school nearby. Her husband is a private paid driver and the sole income earner for the family. In order to supplement the family income, she has been selling clothes for the past 5 years. In order to expand her business she joined the group to access loans.

With her first loan back in 2010, she bought shoes for ladies as well as kids to sell at her store. With her second loan onwards, she began saving INR 500 on monthly basis after meeting the necessary expenditure such as house rent. Now she can run the household budget from her earnings and save her husband's income in totality. She is very happy that she is doing well for the family and helping her husband with regards to earning capital for the future. She plans to buy a plot for her store in future. 

Now she requested another loan to increase her inventory to sell. She means to introduce new items such as synthetic shawls besides the traditional shawls. She will also buy more shoes, socks, handkerchiefs and the like to sell for school-going children for the new session.

Likewise, the rest of the group members too requested another loan to continue with their activities. Yarn store, piggery farming, tea stall, weaving, sale of used clothes, 'paan' shop, and grocery stores are some of the activities of the other members.

loans.use: To increase the inventory to sell at the store, introducing new items such as synthetic shawls besides the traditional shawls.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 58-year-old mother of seven sons and daughters. Aisha makes embroidered dresses to sell to help her husband support the family. Now she applied for this loan to purchase more fabric to make more dresses.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to make dresses

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man. He recently joined the military and is still a university student majoring in Politics. 

Mohammad wants to get his BA degree to help him get a better ranking in the military. He applied for a loan to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en: Hashem is a 26-year-old, married man. He is still a university student, but is working at the same time to support his new family and his education. Hashem has applied for this educational loan to pay for his next semester's fees. He is majoring in child education and care.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.name: Doha

texts.en: Doha is a 21-year-old, single woman. She is one of eight siblings in the family. A couple of years ago, Doha enrolled in the university to study biology. Now, she is applying for this loan to help her in paying for the next semester's fees, so she can graduate as soon as possible and get a job.

loans.use: to pay for the next semester's fees.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en: Shadia is a 20-year-old single lady and she has 8 siblings. Their mother is looking after them and supporting them after their father’s death. Shadia is a university student who is depending on herself to get an education. She is now applying for this educational loan to help her pay the semester fees to get a bachelor degree in accounting and find a job to help her mother with the household finances.

loans.use: to pay the semester fees

loans.name: Suhaib

texts.en:
Suhaib is a third year student at the age of 19. He is studying to become an architect. Suhaib is the oldest brother, with a sister and a brother. They live in a rented home. His father is a teacher, while his mom has a home catering business so they can afford the best for their children.

Because of that, Suhaib is doing his best to pay his parents back by studying hard to graduate as soon as possible and find a suitable job to help in paying the family’s finances. Now he is applying for this loan to help him pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en: Marwa is a 21-year-old, single woman. She has one brother and they are living with their mother after their parents divorced. Marwa is also a university student majoring in Information Technology. She is applying for this educational loan to support her in paying for her next semester's registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's registration fees.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
With the increase in demand and decrease in inventory, Dorine is asking for a new loan to expand upon her existing business. She is a determined woman with the desire to move forward. She still operates her retail shop and her neighbors appreciate her for her kindness, honesty, and, above all, the good services she offers. 

Dorine says that since her previous loan, her business has been growing gradually and thus contributing to her family. With this new loan, she plans to add stocks of flour, basic grains, medicines, and other instant goods. She really appreciates Kiva lenders for the support they gave her and for this current support.

loans.use: to add stocks of flour, basic grains, medicines, and other instant goods for her business.

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo Los Capullitos que conforman 09 socias emprendedoras que pasan al ciclo 15. Marleni tiene 32 años, conviviente con 02 hijos en etapa escolar. Marleni cuenta desde hace 5 años con una bodega de primera necesidad y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Marleni solicito el préstamo para la compra de paneton, chocolate, leche, azúcar. Su sueño es un día ampliar más su negocio donde así pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Marleni está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Kiva. Marleni se encuentra atrás, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo negro.
texts.en: This is the Grupo Los Capullitos, or Little Buds Group, which is comprised of nine entrepreneurs that are in their 15th cycle of borrowing. Marleni is 32 years old and lives with her two school-aged children. She has had a shop that sells basic foodstuff for 5 years with a loyal base of customers. She’s asking for the loan to purchase seasonal fruitcake (panettone), chocolate, milk and sugar. Marleni's dream is to one day grow her business so she can better serve her customers and give her children a better quality of life. She is very happy with this loan and thankful to KIVA. She is the first one on the right in a black polo.

loans.use: purchase seasonal fruitcake (panettone), chocolate, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Las Flores Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Paola es miembro del grupo Las Flores al Progreso

Este grupo lo conforman 09 socias, todas amigas. Paola tiene 32 años  vive con su esposo y su hijo dé 14 años. Paola trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza, empezó con este trabajo por medio de una amiga que la ayudo en sus inicios, durante todo este tiempo ya cuenta con sus propios clientes quienes le solicitan diversos productos en perfumería y maquillaje. Gracias a los ingresos que percibe por su trabajo puede ayudar a su esposo en la manutención de la casa. Paola desea captar más clientela y para eso le gustaría contar con un lugar donde pueda abrir su negocio dedicado a la belleza, el préstamo que ha solicitado a EDAPROSPO lo usara para comprar más productos de belleza y para poder  cumplir con los pedidos pendientes.
Paola se siente feliz  por el préstamo para su grupo comunal, y muy agradecida a los Inversionistas de todo el mundo que los apoyan. Paola  aparece en la foto con casaca de buzo negra con franjas blancas.
*Al lado derecho se encuentra la Sra Betty que viste chompa color naranja, por motivos de fuerza mayor no pudo estar presente para la foto grupal.
texts.en: Paola is a member o the group "Las Flores al Progreso." This group is formed by 9 members, all friends. Paola is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and her 14-year-old son. Paola sells beauty products. She began this work through a friend who helped her at the beginning. Through all this time, she has had her own customers, who ask her for various perfume and makeup products. Thanks to the income that she receives from her work, she can help her husband with the upkeep of the house. Paola wants to attract more customers, and to do this, she would like to have a place where she can open her beauty product business. She will use the loan that she has applied for from EDAPROSPO to buy more beauty products and to be able to fill her pending orders. Paola feels happy about the loan for her communal group, and she is very grateful to the investors from around the world who support them. Paola appears in the photo in the black sports jacket with white stripes. Sra. Betty is seen on the right side wearing an orange sweater; she could not be present for the group photo.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es:
Este es el  grupo Shalom

La Sra. Amable de 53 años es casada y tiene un hijo de 24 años. Ella trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza,  empezó en este trabajo animada por una amiga, son 02 años  que lleva vendiendo y se siente feliz porque  sus ingresos le permiten solventar algunos gastos, sobretodo le gustaría operarse de una dolencia que tiene en sus ojos; para este fin está ahorrando y poder lograrlo. Amable desea tener una tienda donde pueda iniciar un negocio más estable y poder vender toda clase de productos, el dinero de su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes, colonias y maquillaje. Así podrá abastecerse de productos para ofrecer a su clientela que confía en ella por muchos años. La Sra. Amable agradece su apoyo! En la foto aparece vestida con polo verde y chompa negra.
*La Sra. Ruth se agregó al lado derecho de la fotografía.
texts.en:
This is the "Shalom" group.

Señora Amable is 53 years old. She is married and has a son who is 24. She works selling beauty products. She began this work because she was inspired by a friend. She has been selling for two years, and she feels happy because her income allows her to pay some expenses. Above all, she would like to have an operation for an infirmity that she has in her eyes. For this goal, she is saving to be able to achieve it. Amable wants to have a store where she can set up a more stable business and be able to sell all types of products. She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of perfumes, colognes, and makeup. Thus she will be able to stock products to offer to her customers, who have been relying on her for many years.

Señora Amable is grateful for your support! In the photo, she is dressed in a green jersey and a black sweater.
Señora Ruth has been added on the right hand side of the photo.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 39 years old and the mother of seven children. One of her daughters is now a university student majoring in Managerial Information Systems. Mona wants to support her daughter and her education because she believes that education gives a woman power and self confidence. That is why she is applying for this loan, which will allow her to pay the fees for her daughter's next semester.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her upcoming semester at school.

loans.name: Eslam

texts.en: Eslam is a 20-year-old single lady. She has 2 older brothers and one married sister. Eslam is a university student majoring in chemistry. She is applying for this loan to pay her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her next semester fees

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en: Rasha is a 35-year-old married woman. While her husband is serving in the military, she stays at home looking after his two kids from another marriage. Rasha also started a small business at home to fill her free time selling blankets. She is now applying for this loan to increase the quantity of blankets she has and to get a winter collection of clothing items to increase her profits.

loans.use: to get blankets and clothes for sale

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en: Maysoon is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in a rented home. To help her husband in supporting the family and paying the rent, Maysoon works in selling clothing items at home. Now she is applying for a loan to increase the quantity she has by bringing in a winter collection.

loans.use: to bring in a winter collection

loans.name: Hellen Group

texts.en:
This is Hellen's group which is made up of three ladies who sell charcoal, groundnuts, and foodstuffs. Their ages range from 25 to 45.

Hellen is a 45-year-old charcoal seller who is married to a 52-year-old driver. They have two children, all boys. She has been doing this job for 12 years and is in her third loan cycle with ID-Ghana. She has repaid all loans without trouble. Now she is requesting 300 GHS to buy four sacks of charcoal in order to supply her customers. She buys from the market at wholesale prices and sells to customers at retail prices. Her ambition is to also become a wholesale charcoal supplier in the Teshie-Nungua area.

Hellen, Gifty, and Georgina need a total amount of 850 GHS to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
Alasgar is 46 years old and is a farmer who works producing dairy products and animal sales. He gets up early in the morning every day to start his job. His wife helps him to sell meat, milk, and milk products. Alasgar has an infant of schooling age and his biggest goal is to guarantee his education and future. 

At the moment, Alasgar is asking for a loan to buy a breeding cattle, with the aim of increasing his income and starting to build his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a breeding cattle.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham, age 52 and widowed, was left upon her husband's death to raise and support her six sons and daughters on her own. In order to do so, she started knitting clothes as well as selling clothing items that she brings from other markets. 

Siham also sells blankets in winter to increase her profits, and she has applied for this loan in order to buy more blankets to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy blankets to offer for sale

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru has the desire to move forward and she struggles to ensure that she reaches success since she has many goals to meet. She is happy that her son is doing well and that she was able to clear the fees balance for her son, using the last loan.

Nuru has operated a tailoring business, a business she has a passion with. She has many years providing this type of service and it has been successful. She has been able to support her sons and daughters.

This loan will be used to purchase materials to make items of clothing and to purchase spare parts for her sewing machine. Nuru is very popular and well-known in her community because she is a determined and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make items of clothing and to purchase spare parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert, age 50, is a farmer. He lives with his wife and their four children in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Five years ago, he decided to venture into a retail business in order to meet his family's day-to-day expenses, since farming is seasonal. Like all traders, he faces the challenge of price fluctuation. 

His business plan is eventually to own a wholesale shop, as well as to venture into commercialized agriculture. He is a good father to his children and desires to help them attain university degrees. 

Gilbert intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to offer for sale

loans.name: Ganshagai

texts.en:
Mr. Ganshagai, 25 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2009, he has been working as a designer at his brother’s private designing company. Before working there, he was rendering taxi services to local people. His wife works at home by sewing blouses and tunics and sells them for 2,500 MNT each to a wool clothes factory.

 This young family is in need of an automobile, which will be used for a taxi service as an extra income source and also for transportation purposes. So Ganshagai is requesting a loan of 5,500,000 MNT to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. 

As a result, the family can use their automobile as a transporter in the harsh winter period, as well as in Ganshagai’s free time, when he could use the car as a taxi for an income source. 

Most importantly, an automobile which runs on natural gas emits less smoke, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase a car that runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Sadig

texts.en:
Sadig, age 24, raises and sells sheep to earn a living. He and his wife have a seven-month-old baby. His wife is a homemaker, and she tries to help her husband with his business. The primary income for the family comes from fattening and selling the sheep or meat. 
 
Sadig wants to increase the size of his herd before the prices goes up, so he is planning to buy more sheep with his loan proceeds. Eventually, Sadig would like to buy a lorry to use for carrying his animals to the selling place.

He thanks all lenders for supporting him in his hour of need.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Abc-Group

texts.en:
This group is made of two members named Rose and Abibio, both residents of Teshie. They have been a group for a year now and are doing very well. Both Rose and Abibio are fish vendors.

Rose, age 45, has been selling fish for the past 22 years and her business is thriving. She has many regular customers because of her integrity and frankness. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is very happy to be a long-term member of the organization. She has taken out two loans and has fully repaid them both. For her third loan, she is requesting GHC 500 to help her meet her customers' demand. 

Together, the two members of this group are requesting a loan amount of GHC 850 in order to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in and around Teshie.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Camlita

texts.en:
Camlita's enterprising nature has enabled her to gain fame in her neighborhood. Thanks to her efforts and determination, she has been able to grow her business. What she started as a possibility has turned out to be a reliable business which has provided her with income to support her family. Camlita is happy now that she has enough space for her customers. 

With this loan, she will buy ingredients like wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
MARÍA es una socia emprendedora junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos ellos se dedican a la actividad del cultivo y producción de granos básicos, ella aprendió la agricultura hace más de 30 años siendo sus padres los que le enseñaron el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, sus siembras son cultivados a 300 metros de su casa de habitación trasladándose a pie diariamente, María no pudo estudiar en su juventud y sus sueños son educar a sus 2 hijos para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor nivel de educación, sus 2 hijos le ayudan a cultivar granos básicos en sus vacaciones y cuando salen de la escuela por la tarde al igual que con la ayuda de su esposo.

María Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de un panel solar el cual lo ha anhelado desde hace mucho tiempo ya que en el lugar donde ella habita no hay energía eléctrica, durante mucho tiempo ella ha luchado con sus oficios domésticos y cotidianos en compañía de luz con candela comercial o/y luz con astillas de madera de pino.

Su sueño es levantarse temprano por la mañana y luego presionara el interruptor que iluminara su humilde hogar, que también en sus hijos habrá un cambio trascendental ya que podrán estudiar y elaborar sus actividades estudiantiles en horas nocturnas.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking woman together with her husband and her two children. They make a living farming and producing basic grains. She learned to farm more than 30 years ago as her parents were those who taught her to plant corn and beans. She plants her crops 300 meters from her home and she walks there everyday. María was not able to study in her youth and her dream is to educate her two children so that they can have a better quality of life and a higher level of education. Her children help her in planting basic grains during their vacations and when they come home from school in the afternoon. Her husband also helps her. 

María is currently requesting help to purchase a solar panel, which she has longed for for some time. Where she lives there is no electric power and for a long time she has struggled with her domestic and daily tasks with the light from a candle and/or sticks of pine wood. 

Her dream is to get up early in the mornings and press a button that will illuminate her humble home. She also hopes that her children will experience a major change as they will be able to study and do their student projects at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her house.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina operates a food stall business where she sells a variety of African dishes. She is happy in her work and her business has been slowly growing. This growth is due to her own efforts and determination and has been helped along by the support she has received. She has gained a good deal of sales experience through this venture. 

Amina tells us that since her previous loan, her living standards have greatly improved. 

She is asking for this new loan to buy ingredients for her food stall, such as rice, beans, sugar, oils, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall, such as rice, beans, sugar, oils, and vegetables

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a property management businessperson and a carpenter by trade, wants a Fresh Life toilet for several reasons. In addition to providing sanitation to the Mukuru informal settlements in Kenya, he also wants a Fresh Life toilet for his tenants.

George, who is married with four children, also co-directs a property management firm in Mukuru, where he has lived for over a decade. 

His hopes for the future are to expand his property management business and be able to generate enough profit to support his family's dreams. In the short term, he plans to purchase more rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 30-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. A father to three children, he is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been in this profession for eight years and was inspired into service by his love of nurturing young people. Low salary is his major challenge; his salary is not enough to meet his family's needs. His dream is to venture into the housing business. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy cement and iron sheets to complete his commercial house.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron sheets to complete his commercial house.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a single woman, aged 37, and a mother to three children aged 14, 11, and 6 years. She owns a retail store where she sells general merchandise. A resident of Kagadi, Uganda, she has been in this business for 12 years. She supplements her sales with selling produce. She plans to build a good residential house and trade in wholesale, despite the challenge of having a lack of funds. Oliver intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise such as soap and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 40, is a primary teacher and has been in service for a period of 20 years. He interacts primarily with community members and school-going children and describes himself as a hard-working, trustworthy, and honest man. Joseph is fond of children and became a teacher because he was fueled by the desire to inspire the younger generation. He and his wife have seven children: the youngest is a one-year-old baby and the eldest is 16 years old.

Like many civil servants, Joseph is disappointed with the low salary that he earns, since it is insufficient for meeting his family's needs. As he cannot support his family on his salary alone, his plan is to venture into mechanized agriculture. 

Joseph intends to use his loan funds to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Sedrack

texts.en: Sedrack is a 30-year-old government employee who works as a school teacher. He has been doing this for nine years. A father to four children, he is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He was inspired to go into the teaching profession by family members. He operates a retail produce shop in order to supplement his low salary. Like all good fathers, he dreams of educating his children to the university level. He also wants to set up sustainable income-generating activities to supplement his income. Sedrack intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Ivan

texts.es:
Daniel es un joven de 21 años de edad. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima calido y por poseer playas hermosas. Danmiel es un joven copn muchas ganas de salir adelnate es por ello que desde joven aprendio a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres atravesaron por muchos problemas economcios y con el fin de ayudarlos empezo a trabajar.  Es asi que dia a dia Daniel trabaja como operario de costura en una empresa textil de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al dia y el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque es honrado.

Daniel esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra pagar los tramites de matricula ya que ha ingresado a estudiar en un instituto de su ciudad, y con este apoyo el podra tener toda la documentacion requerida por el instituto y pagar la matricula, asi el podra seguir luchando cada dia par poder ahcer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Terminar una carrera profesional y poder formar un estudio de abogados".
texts.en:
Daniel is a young man, age 21. His home is located in the city of Chincha, which is a city characterized by a warm climate and beautiful beaches. Daniel is a young man with a great desire to get ahead. Because of this, he learned to make a living through hard work at a young age because his parents had to deal with many economic problems. He started to work at a young age in order to help them. Day in, day out, Daniel works as a sewing operator for a textile company in the city. He works about eight hours per day and thinks that it is going well for him because he is very responsible and, above all, because he is honest.
Daniel has signed up to study at an institute in the city. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because their support will allow him to pay the enrollment fees. This support will allow him to get the proper documentation required by the institution and to pay the fees. This way, he will be able to keep working hard every day in order to realize his greatest dream: "To have a professional degree and open a law firm."

loans.use: to pay enrollment fees.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a married man with eight children, residing in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a local brew business which he has run for ten years now. He also operates a produce business to supplement the local brew. He dreams of buying a lorry to help him in the transportation of brew and produce, despite challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuation that affect his business growth. 

Deo is requesting a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar, age 41, is a government employee who works as a local council three chief. He has been in service for two years. He took up his current position after he was elected by his community members during local elections, in which he achieved a landslide victory. He and his wife have eight children and the family lives in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Oscar is also a fisherman. With the proceeds of his previous loan, he has been able to build a house for the family and to venture into the produce business, which has proven to be very lucrative.

Oscar intends to use the loan to buy rice, maize, and beans to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize, and beans to offer for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 58-year-old widow who sells kenkey (cooked corn paste) with fish. She resides in Teshie. She has been in this business for the past 25 years and is still doing very well. 

She has taken four loans already from ID-Ghana. This is her fifth loan, and she needs GHS 650. She will use the loan to expand her business, by buying more ingredients for the food she will sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more corn to use in preparing kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 53 years old and married.  She is from the Adjorman group. She trades in chemical drugs, which she has been doing for seven years. She uses her profit to support her husband in their building project. 

Mary is requesting her sixth loan from ID Ghana for 500 GHC, which she will use to buy more drugs to sell.  She hopes to expand her business to satisfy her customers. She is innovative and a hardworking individual who is committed in all she does. She has been with ID for two and half years.

loans.use: to purchase drugs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gelber Mauricio

texts.es:
Gelber, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para poder realizar la siembra, ya que está realizando una nueva temporada en hortalizas, pepino, ejote y tomates, para esto el necesita comprar semilla de tomates, pepino, fertilizantes y otros productos para la siembra.
El manifiesta que ha trabajado con préstamos porque su experiencia ha sido positiva, han mejorado sus cultivos y debido a eso sus ingresos para la familia han sido estables, tambien comenta que ha ido aumentando el área de siembra para aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Gelber has decided to take out a new loan in order to sow crops. It is a new season for vegetables: peppers, green beans, and tomatoes. He needs to buy tomato and pepper seeds, fertilizers, and other products for the sowing.
He says that he takes out loans because his experience has been positive; loans have improved his crops, and so his income for his family has been stable. He also tells us that he has been able to expand his fertile land and increase production.

loans.use: to buy tomato and pepper seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 29-year-old, government employee, who works as a primary school teacher. He has been in service as a teacher for two and one-half years. He is a father to two children, married, and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He was inspired to enter the teaching profession by the respect it commands among the community members in Uganda.

In order to supplement his low salary he ventured into the coffee-growing business, despite the challenges of price fluctuations and high operational costs. His dream is to buy land and grow coffee on a large scale. Fred intends to use this loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for coffee farming, the profit from which will supplement his low teaching salary.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace from Teshie. She is 54 years old and married to Harry, 58, a tax collector. They have two children. 

Grace is a fish seller. She has been in this business for the past 23 years and is doing very well. She joined ID Ghana in 2011, after being introduced to it by another client. She has since taken three loans from ID Ghana. 

Grace is applying for her fourth loan now, and she needs GHS 1,000. She will use this amount to buy more fish to sell to her customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more fish, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, water and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
This is Everlyne, 31, a resident of Voi, Kenya. She is married to Darmian, an employee, and is a mother of three children. Together with her husband, Everlyne manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She operates a variety store. She has been in this business for the last three years. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 50,000 KES loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Everlyne hopes to have a car and dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 32-year-old government employee who works as a secondary school teacher . He has been in service for six years now. He is married, has three children and lives in Kagadi Uganda. His desire to contribute to the knowledge-building of the nation led him to the teaching profession. He also is involved in agriculture and cattle keeping for milk production to supplement his salary. His dreams are to educate his children and build a permanent residential house. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets, nails for construction and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, nails for construction and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth e suna joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la el Caserio de San martin de Porras, caracterizado porque habitan personas que hace algunos años pproductos de las inundaciones en la ciudad de Ica se quedaron sin vivienda y formaron esta localidad. Lizeth vive al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere mucho y sobre todo apoya con el fruto de su trabajo y quienes a pesar de su condicion humilde pudieron apoyarla y logro estudiar la carrera de Educacion.

Debido a que no pudo encontrar un empleo de acuerdo a su carrera Lizeth con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro formar su negocio de venta de productos cosmeticos, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente ya que ella va a visitarlos en sus domicilios; ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y tambien porque da facilidades para el pago de los productos.

Lizeth esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra comprar un modulo de drywall para poder construir su cuarto ya que debido a las lluvias, el techo se cayo porque este era de esteras y adobe, con esta mejora ella podra tener uan mejor calidad de vida y seguir esforzandose y luchando por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener un local propio".
texts.en:
Lizeth, 19, lives in the hamlet of San Martín de Porras, characterized as being formed several years ago by people who lost their homes in floods in the city of Ica.  Lizeth lives with her parents, whom she loves very much and supports with the fruit of her labor.  They were able to support her despite their humble situation, and she managed to study education.

Lizeth wasn't able to find a job in her field, so with great effort and savings she managed to start her own business selling cosmetics.  She works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 10 customers because she visits them in their homes.  She believes she's getting ahead because she's friendly with her customers and also offers terms for making payments on the products.

Lizeth is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy a piece of drywall to build her room.  The roof, which was made of rush mats and adobe, fell because of the rains.
