It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susan hopes to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
Lene is 57 years old and widowed with five children.

Lene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like soft drinks, soap, sugar, and coffee, etc.

Lene has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenechimeg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband renders taxi service to local people using his own automobile. Before rendering taxi service, he was doing construction maintenance work in the summertime. Since 2010, she has been working as a neonatologist at maternity house. Two years ago, the family purchased a plot of land, and recently they have begun to build a house. But due to lack of finance the interior decoration work remains, so she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase the necessary construction materials. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable place, and the completely insulated house will enable them to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert wants to exceed his profit for his four children. For this reason, he is now asking for a loan amount of PHP 20,000 for additional working capital in his farming business. It would be used to buy seeds to plant, fertilizers, and pesticides. He hopes that his crops will not be destroyed by any devastating insect or typhoon so that he can easily attain his aspiration. His wish is that the income can be used for his family's future as well as saved for continuing his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lucy is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La Sra. Manuela es una persona de carácter muy amigable, ella se define como una mujer, luchadora, humilde, alegre y muy trabajadora,  Manuela  vive en la ciudad de Tulcán, provincia del Carchi al norte del Ecuador, Ella es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 11 años a quien ama y lucha  día a día por sacarle a delante, Manuela inculca valores éticos y religiosos a su hijo, son estas cualidades que hacen de manuela una mujer digna de admiración.
Manuela solicita a FODEMI un crédito que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos, libros, útiles escolares, útiles de oficina y papel en diferentes tamaños para utilizar en la copiadora que tiene dentro de su papelería, ya que su negocio está creciendo muy rápido y necesita más inversión para lograr cubrir la demanda existente de clientes.
El sueño que doña Manuela tiene es seguir trabajando en su papelería y copiadora por que le esta yendo bien y sabe que si sigue trabajando e invirtiendo mejor su dinero, podrá dar a su hijo una buena educación y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela is a very friendly person, and she defines herself as fighter, modest, cheerful and hardworking. Manuela lives in the city of Tulcán, in the Charchi province in the north of Ecuador. She is a single mother and has a son who is 11 years old. She loves him and fights every day to get ahead. Manuela instills ethical and religious values to her son. These are the qualities that make Manuela an admirable woman.

Manuela is requesting a loan to FODEMI which will be invested in the purchase of notebooks, books, school supplies, office supplies, and paper in different sizes to use in the copier she has in her stationery. Because her business is growing very fast, she needs more investment to meet the demand of existing customers. 

Manuela's dream is to continue working in her stationery and as a copier because she is doing well and knows that if she keeps working and investing her money better, she will be able to give a good education to her son and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, books, school and office supplies, and also boxes of copier paper.

loans.name: Lkhagva

texts.en:
Lkhagva, 58 years old, lives with his two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. One of his sons works as a driver and explosive engineer at a mining company. His other son works in Korea on an employment contract and transfers money in urgent situations. Lkhagva himself has been working as a gate keeper at a kindergarten since 2008. The house in which his family resides has been deteriorating over the years and needs serious repair. Also, as winter approaches Mongolia, the automobile garage they use is in need of insulation. 

Thus, he is requesting a loan of 6800000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as planks, panels, independent ceiling, doors, vacuum insulated windows, bricks, blocks, cement, sand, pebbles and an iron roof. As a result, his family will be able to live in a warm and comfortable home while parking their car in an insulated garage. Most importantly, his family will burn less coal to heat their house, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. Additionally, a car parked in a warm garage has the benefits of stable usage, lower fuel consumption, and lower probability of breaking down compared to automobiles parked outside.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a 50-year-old, married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Luz sells pesticides and fertilizers in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and pesticides to sell.

Luz has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and pesticides to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Brimlee

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Brimlee works hard to support her family, including two of her children currently in school.

She sells charcoal in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat and fishing. Ma. Brimlee is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Brimlee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Eva Francis

texts.en:
Eva Francis is 30 years of age, married, and has one child. Her husband is a building contractor. Eva Francis manages a sari-sari store business in their village. She usually sells curls, breads, candies, and soft drinks. 

Eva Francis's goal in life is to uplift their living condition. She is striving and manages the business well to earn profit. Eva Francis wants to extend the products she sells to her costumers. For this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy toothpaste, soap, shampoo and canned goods. She hopes to increase her sales and income as well.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, soap, shampoo, and canned goods.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marcel works hard to support her family. She buys and sells crabs as well as some charcoal.

Marcel has sustained her business through her past seven loans from NWTF. She is applying for a 13,000 PHP loan now to buy more crabs to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to sell.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is 59 years of age and blessed with two children. He is a farmer in their community who has been operating his farming business for 20 years. It has been his main source of income, which provides for the necessities of his family. He always wanted to see his family in a good way of living. For this reason, he’s in need of additional working capital to purchase the necessary inputs for his farming. He is asking for a loan amount of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers. Hopefully, this time he can yield more so that he can save for the future of his family as well as for his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Clarie

texts.en: Clarie is 47 years old and an industrious father of two children. He is very eager to support his family through his farming business. With this kind of occupation, he is able to provide for his family's basic necessities, but is not able to save for his farming business. So, he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. He hopes to protect his business with these inputs and earn sufficient income to improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies to prepare and sell kava.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 47 years old and is married. He operates a "sari sari" store, the common name for a variety store, in his village where he sells canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and spices. He has had this business for three years. Mario earns PHP 2,000 from the business each week which he puts back into the operation of his store to maintain and eventually grow it for his family's needs. He is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, candies, crackers and soft drinks to attract more customers and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, candies, crackers and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lina Fe

texts.en:
Lina Fe is 48 years old, married and has five school-age children. She buys and sells eggs and dried fish in the market to supplement her husband's income. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aims to increase her income and improve her business. This will allow her to continue sending her children to school. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 25,000 to buy additional stocks of eggs, dried fish and vegetables to sell. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to improve her business. She hopes that someday she will make the business grow and all her children will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of eggs, dried fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 39 años, es un mujer amable, buena y emprendedora, hace 13 años convive con José de 37 años de edad, junto a él tiene dos hijos menores: José Enrique de 13 y Blanca de 6 años, viven juntos en una casa alquilada desde hace 2 años y ahí comparten su lucha diaria por mejorar su situación económica y salir adelante en el camino del progreso. El trabajo de Elizabeth consiste en la venta de gaseosas al público en general, además vende prendas de vestir para niños y adolescentes. Ha establecido recientemente su pequeño negocio en la puerta del lugar donde vive, pero se dedica a esta actividad cerca de 9 años, siempre ha trabajado sola porque así se siente más tranquila ya que considera que de esa forma mantiene el orden y no tiene ninguna presión al momento de atender a sus clientes. Algunas veces prepara postres los cuales vende por las calles de la ciudad a los transeúntes. Se siente muy feliz porque sabe que todas las actividades laborales que realiza le produce los ingresos económicos que necesita para solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar, sin embargo sabe que tiene que continuar esforzándose muchísimo para mantener esta situación, espera seguir trabajando para hacer crecer aún más su negocio y más adelante comprarse un terreno para construir su casa y ahí establecer como negocio un pequeño bar. Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir una vez más con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 3800) comprará principalmente mayor cantidad de gaseosas en litros, también comprará ciertas prendas de vestir para venderlos en la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 39 years old, is a good, kind, and entrepreneurial woman. For 13 years, she has been living with 37-year-old José, together with whom she has two younger children: 13-year-old José and 6-year-old Blanca. They have been living together in a rented house for 2 years and there they share their daily endeavor to improve their economic situation and to move forward on the road to progress. 

Elizabeth's work consists of selling soft drinks to the general public. Also, she sells clothing for children and adolescents. She has recently established her small business on her doorstep, but she has been doing this activity for around 9 years. She always has worked alone because in that way she feels calmer considering that in this manner she maintains order and doesn't have any pressure while attending to customers. Sometimes she prepares desserts which she sells on the city streets to passers-by. She feels very happy because she knows that all the labor activities that she does generates the income that she needs to cover the basic expenses of her home; however, she knows that she has to continue to strive greatly in order to maintain this situation. She hopes to keep working to further grow her business, and later to buy herself land to construct her house and to establish a small bar there as a business. 

This is her 9th loan with MFP; therefore, she is grateful for the opportunity and confidence that they place in her in order to receive this loan. On the other hand, she is once again committed to comply with the payment of her dues in a timely manner. In addition, she likes being a part of the communal bank which she belongs to since she has seen that its members are responsible people and supportive of one another. With the requested amount (3800 PEN), she will mainly buy liters of soft drinks. Also, she will buy certain clothing to sell in the summer.

loans.use: to buy liters of soft drinks, and also clothing to sell during the summer.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling lobster. Lilia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like eggs, spices, biscuits, soap, and noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She owns a small retail store where she sells such personal products as dresses, cosmetics and shoes. She is also into direct sales for Natasha, Avon, and Barley. She and her husband work hard to provide for their family’s everyday expenses.

Soledad previously took out and repaid a 50,000 PHP loan from CCT, which she used to buy merchandise for her business. She is applying for another 50,000 PHP loan to increase her product inventory. She knows that the more she has on display and available, the better, and the greater will be her profits.

Soledad’s ambition is to grow her business and help her children finish their studies. She looks forward to this loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

All CCT community clients, of which Soledad is one, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 43 years old, married and has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs. Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 to buy medicine, feed and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years and is thankful for the good impact on their living.

loans.use: to buy medicine, feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en: Ms. Farah is a 44-year-old woman. She has been doing the business of hand-embroidery. She makes beautiful and unique embroidered patterns and then exports them to nearby cities and other countries as well. She is a hardworking woman and makes enough to contribute to the family income despite the fact that she is physically disabled. In order to purchase more spools of threads and fabric with packs of sequins, pearls, and stones in various colors, she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads and fabric with packs of sequins, pearls, and stones in various colors.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 25-year-old, married woman. She has been running a beauty parlor in her community for the past two years. Her husband works as a watchman in a hospital, but his income alone is not sufficient to meet the basic needs of the family members. This compelled Zarina to initiate her own business to contribute to the family's income. Two years ago she opened a beauty parlor in the corner of her house. Over time she has become famous for providing high quality services to her customers.

In order to meet the requirements of her parlor, she contacted Kashf Foundation for the second time and applied for a loan of 15,000 PKR. This loan would help her to purchase more packs of beauty products, makeup kits and cleansers. 

Zarina expects an increase in her net income by catering to more customers time after time. She wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of beauty products, makeup kits and cleansers.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Ms Nazeeran is 42 years old and married. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last six years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband also assists her in purchasing stock of goods from the market. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at a lower price. She then would be able to meet with the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown an excellent credit history. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital as well.

loans.use: to buy rice and flour to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, aged 37, is attentive to his farming business in order to achieve the hope of having a relaxed living to his family. He is asking ASKI for additional working capital of PHP 25,000. It will be use to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. He is hoping that these inputs will be a great help in developing his farming business. If it would happen, he can be able to save for the future of his two children. He must be the happiest father and husband.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from boarding house rentals.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms Sughran is a 36-year-old hardworking and passionate woman who faced many problems during her early married life. Her husband is a laborer. He was not able to cover the expenses of the family members alone. Then Sughran took the initiative to start her business of hand embroidery by taking a loan from Kashf foundation one year ago. At this time, she is very much satisfied and makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Sughran dreams of providing a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms Nazia is 32 years old and married lady with five children. She has been selling fruit with her husband for many years. They serve their community well by providing fresh quality fruits to their customers. Nazia assists her husband by packing the fruits properly in the boxes and then loading them on his cart.

In order to purchase more fresh fruits, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 20,000. This will enable her husband to purchase bananas, apples and oranges of fresh quality. Nazia expects a boost in their net income through their large sales. The couple dreams of purchasing their own house and wants to provide a quality education for their children.

loans.use: to purchase fresh quality bananas, apples and oranges to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, and soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Lilia has been in this business for 22 years. Lilia earns more income from food vending.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been engaged in the business of stitching for the past five years. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong. 

However, business challenges combined with family expenditures frustrate her nearly every day. Initially she faced a lot of problems, especially in meeting the daily expenditures of her children. Over time however Mumtaz became popular on her street and has become the best earning resource in her household. 

In order to purchase a new sewing machine, she has applied for the second time for a loan of Rs. 25,000 from the Kashf foundation. It will enable her to fulfill the demand of her customers efficiently. 

She shares her dream of opening a training center for the girls of her area.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 22 years old and has three infant-age children. Due to the hardship of living, she was engaged in buying and selling of fruits and vegetables to help her husband in generating income while she took care of her three kids. They aimed to improve their poor living condition in order to educate their children and give them a better life. In this regard, she planned to improve her business and make it a more viable and profitable source of income. Due to financial difficulty, she is asking for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of pineapples, garlic, bananas, avocados, hot peppers, gingers and coconut for sale. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve the business and hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of pineapples, garlic, bananas, avocados, hot peppers, gingers and coconut to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a loving mother of two kids. Her husband is a farmer, planting and harvesting rice in their field. With her determination to help her husband even in just a simple way, Lilia engaged herself in the direct selling business of fragrances and beauty products. 

At present, Lilia’s husband and children are still living with her parents. Her dream is to have her own family house. Lilia is working hard to make her dream a reality. Lilia is seeking a way to reach her dream. She thinks that by expanding the products she sells, she may increase her profits. Lilia is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase lotion, make-up and fragrances. She hopes that someday she will build her own family house.

loans.use: to purchase lotion, make-up and fragrances.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 24 years old, and is married with one child.

To generate income, she and her husband manage their transportation business. They have been in this business for 10 months. At this moment, Jonalyn is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy wheels, oil, and gasoline for the maintenance of their transport motorcycle. 

Jonalyn hopes that she can improve her business and she also hopes that she can build another business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy wheels, oil, and gasoline for the maintenance of their transport motorcycle.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa, 43, is a resident of Batasan, Manila, Philippines. She is a mother to her children and is married to Felix, an installer. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand-in-hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jesusa owns oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Jesusa hopes to have more capital for her growing business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines. They were originally made from US military jeeps left over from World War II and are known from their flamboyant decoration and crowded seating. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. They have become a ubiquitous symbol of Philippine culture. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Lingling

texts.en:
Lingling works hard to support her family. Lingling is single and has a buying and selling ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Lingling requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Lingling has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Lingling would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a loving woman. She is 43 years old and has five children. She raises hogs and sells them for profit. She continued in the business while her children were still studying. 

Right now, Arlene is now borrowing 12,000 PHP to buy vaccines, feed, and medicine to sustain her hogs. Aside from raising hogs, she also raises chickens and will buy feed for them, too. With hard work, she hopes to achieve economic stability someday.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed, and medicine to sustain her hogs.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is originally from Uruguay and came to the United States 13 years ago. He started to work in the construction industry on apartment improvement projects before becoming a manager at the DC location of the La Tasca Restaurant. As manager, he often dealt with different construction companies to repair, maintain, and remodel the restaurant.

Enrique now works as the owner of Cimarron Contracting, LLC. Cimarron is a construction company that provides property maintenance services in the Washington metro area, including all of La Tasca’s five locations in the region. Since 2010, to diversify his business to stay active during the winter months when restaurant maintenance needs are less frequent, Enrique and his business partner have sought snow removal contracts. 

Thanks to Enrique’s hard work, Cimmaron has a new contract for snow removal in Fairfax County for this winter. His Kiva loan will be used to help Enrique execute the contract and buy equipment, including safety vests and shoes, hard hats, and a tire chain. 

Enrique uses the business to support his three children – two girls and one boy.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his new snow removal contract in Fairfax County, Virginia

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo is originally from El Salvador and arrived in the United States in 1993. In El Salvador, Abelardo owned a refreshments distribution company, and his wife, Luz, worked in a store as a clerk. They have four children, two older and two younger. 

In 1998, Abelardo started working informally on various construction projects, specializing in drywall. After some initial success, he continued to work on small projects until he obtained the necessary licenses to register his small business, Abero Construction Inc., in 2006. 

After losing his home to foreclosure in 2008, Abelardo has worked hard to bounce back. Because of his 12 years of work in the industry, he used his network to obtain multiple contracts, usually as a subcontractor of a larger construction company. His business is now profitable, in part because he adapted his business model to only accept positions as lead contractor.

Abelardo's Kiva loan will be used to support him with working capital to cover the daily expenses of his growing construction business and strengthen his business credit. Over the next six years, he hopes to double his profits and access more government contracts.

loans.use: to grow his construction company.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is originally from El Salvador and arrived in Maryland five years ago. In a difficult decision, she left behind her parents and her 13-year-old son to try to create a better future for the family in the United States. In El Salvador, Guadalupe worked in the accounting department of a coffee factory.

In 2009, after exploring different ideas for businesses, Guadalupe started Multienvios, a small business in Langley Park, Maryland. She sells cell phones, calling cards, remittances services and a variety of merchandise ranging from jewelry to clothing. She started the business with funds she had saved for two years, and the business is profitable.

This year, Guadalupe seized an opportunity to expand her business into Virginia. By subletting a small space in Falls Church, she was able to register the business and hire a new full-time employee to work at the store. 

Guadalupe's Kiva loan will be used to support her with funds to buy new inventory, including cell phones for the holiday season, for the Virginia store. Having been denied a traditional bank loan, the loan will also help Guadalupe strengthen her credit history in the United States.

She currently lives in Silver Spring with her partner and their new 8-month-old son, David.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her new business location in Virginia.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to test interest in a new side business venture to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finance startup costs for her new business, including hiring a full-time administrative assistant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory (color, sizes and styles) for her small business supporting tailors in Uganda

loans.name: Bat-Itgel

texts.en:
Bat-Itgel is a 33-year-old married man who has two sons and lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He is a merchandiser at a local company. His two sons attend kindergarten. His wife is a professional baker at fancy cake factory. When she took maternity leave, Bat-Itgel decided to operate their small fancy cake factory in addition to his present work. 

Then Bat-Itgel rented a small factory room in order to bake fancy cakes. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase contemporary styled bags to conserve their cakes. His wife is really overjoyed for their business.

loans.use: to promote his fancy cake sale for his bakery business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 45 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, energy drinks, etc.

Alma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns income from fishing. Alma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, energy drinks, etc.

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Amarzaya is married, 40 years old, and has two children. Both children attend high school. The family lives in a house in a local get district, which lacks basic infrastructure of the city. 

Amarzaya is an ambulance doctor, while her spouse owns a bus and operates a public transportation business. In the winter season, all drivers face very difficult car freeze-up problems. For this reason she and her husband want to build their own garage for her husband's bus.

loans.use: to build a garage for her husband's bus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Byambadorj is a 54-year-old father of three children. He lives with his family in a house, which is located in the outer ger district. He rents his house's downstairs rooms to others. He is the only person in his family who has an income, so he plans to operate a fuel/firewood sale business during the cold winter season.

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase a small truck in order to transport fuel/firewood to sell during the winter.

loans.use: to buy a small truck in order to transport fuel/firewood for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the video-k machine

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell herbal supplement and kitchen wares business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell for her business. Dolores has been in this business for nine years. 

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her health store.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 29 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marife has been farming rice for 11 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Marife is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 42, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Gregorio, a laborer and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Teresita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to expand her business and dreams to have an organized and good life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in a food-vending business selling barbecue to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. Merly is asking for a loan to buy more materials/ingredients for barbeque like meat, sauce, sticks, seasonings and others. Merly believes that this loan could help her in improving her business. In the future, Merly dreams of expanding her business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more materials/ingredients for barbeque like meat, sauce, sticks, seasonings and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en: Ma. Lilibeth is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in seaweed farming business together with her husband for more than eight years now. This is the source of their income. Ma. Lilibeth is asking for a loan to buy materials for seaweed farming like seaweed seedlings, straw, and farm. With this, they will be able to improve their seaweed farming business thus augmenting their harvest and profit. In the future, Ma. Lilibeth dreams of making their business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for seaweed farming like seaweed seedlings, straw, and farm.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 33 years old and married with four children, three of whom are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Monaliza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, sugar, canned goods, milk, choco, etc.

Monaliza has been in this business for 19 years.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business and help her children go to school through college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, sugar, canned goods, milk, choco, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Ubay, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari, or variety store, business for more than ten years now. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her place. Her husband is a carpenter.

Rebecca is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, chips, snack foods, seasonings, soap and toiletries. Rebecca hopes that this loan can help her to expand her business and profit. 

In the future, she dreams of improving her store and augment her revenue. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, chips, snack foods, seasonings, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Kantiguiya Group

texts.fr:
KANTIGUIYA est un groupe de l’association Danaya de N’tentou. Il regroupe 4 femmes mariées qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 3 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires et d’habillements à l’image de MASSARAN  qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’tentou (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a un an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
MASSARAN, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 pièces de pagne et de bazin.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et vend ses articles à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Kantiguiya is a group from the Danaya association in N’tentou. It comprises 4 married women who know one another through family links and the neighbourhood. They are 25 years old and have 3 children each on average; they have different business activities such as the sale of condiments, or of clothing as is the case with Massaran - who is the person on the far left of the photo.
They live in large traditional families in N’tentou (the Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been small traders for several years, and are in high demand for their services.
In order to satisfy the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan programme one year ago. They are on their second mutual loan. Massaran is skilled at selling clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 traditional outfits of different types. She buys her stock in Bamako and sells the products in Ouelessebougou, retail, for cash and credit to both men and women.
She hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000FCFA - enough to allow her to repay the loan and to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase outfits.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a patient mother dedicated to her work. She is 51 years old, and engages in a piggery business. She earns PHP 8,000 per head if her pigs are healthy and well-nourished. With the aim of upgrading her income, Leonila is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vitamins. She hopes that she can earn a higher income this time to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retail business.

Nancy has been in this business for 4 years. 

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Teriya est un groupe de l’association Balimaya  regroupant 4 femmes toutes mariées qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 5 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et de légumes à l’image de AMI qui est la deuxième assise de la droite vers la gauche. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou, quartier Mission Catholique, dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 3 ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
AMI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, elle excelle dans la vente de légumes de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate fraiche, oignon, choux, aubergine.).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Teriya is a group from the Balimaya association, comprising four married women who know one another through family links and the neighbourhood. They are forty years old and have five children each on average; they have different business activities such as the purchase and sale of condiments and vegetables, as is the case with Ami who is the second person seated in the photo, from right to left.
They live in large traditional families in the catholic mission district of Ouelessebougou, in Kati county (the Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been small traders for several years, and are in high demand for their services.
In order to satisfy the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan programme three years ago. They are on their fourth mutual loan. 
Ami, who is the group's president and is very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the sale of vegetables and condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy various food condiments (pepper, fresh tomatoes, onion, cabbage, aubergine). She buys her stock in Bamako and from local wholesalers, and sells the products in Ouelessebougou, retail, for cash and credit to both men and women.
She hopes to make a monthly profit of 15,000FCFA - enough to allow her to repay the loan and to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: As a married parent of eight children, Margarita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Margarita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, bread, soap, milk, etc for her general store business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, bread, soap, milk, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business. Maria has been in this business for four years. Maria earns more income from raising pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасану 32 года. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, которую зовут Дилором. Хасан добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он работает в кондитерской фабрике в столице своей республики. Его жена живет на севере, и он приезжает к жене лишь 1 раз за 3 месяца. Он хочет жить вместе женой, однако трудное условие жизни заставляет его работать больше в столице, так как он не смог найти подходящую работу в своем городе. Его работа тяжелая и он имеет не здоровый образ жизни, то есть некому готовить ему еду и стирать одежды. Из-за трудного условия проживания он потерял здоровье и не может завести детей. Хасан и его жена очень хотять иметь детей. Хасан запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для своего лечения. Этот займ поможет такому хорошему человеку улучшить свое здоровье. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hasan is 32 years old. He is married to a wonderful woman by the name of Dilorom. Hasan is a kind and hard-working person. He works in a candy factory in his country's capital city. Hasan's wife lives in the country's north, and he is only able to visit her once every 3 months. Hasan would like to be able to live together with his wife, but is forced to work mostly in the capital after being unable to find suitable employment in his home city.

Hasan works very hard and does not lead a healthy lifestyle, with no one to cook for him or launder his clothes. Due to his difficult living conditions, his health has suffered and he has been unable to father children. Since Hasan and his wife would love to have children, he is requesting a loan of 2500 somoni for medical treatment. This loan will help to improve a good person's health. Hasan is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medication for his treatment

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru:
Хусан отец 4 детей и любящий муж. Жена домохозяйка.  Его вид деятельности заключается в разведении скота.  Он разводит дома скот.   У Хусана большой дом и хозяйство. Его семья поддерживает в развитии его хозяйства, они помогают выращивать овощи и разводить скот.   Каждые 5-6 месяцев Хусан выводит откормленных коров на рынок для продажи, а овец каждые 2 месяца.  Хусан кроме откорма скота работает на стройке маляром но основной доход от откорма скота.  В его отсутствии его дети и жена ухаживают за скотом. 
На полученный кредит Хусан планирует купить скот и корма для скота. Он очень благодарит такие организации как  Кива за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Husan is a father of 4 children and a loving husband. His wife takes care of the household, while he is engaged in raising livestock at his home. Husan has a large house and adjacent property, and his family gives him a hand by helping to cultivate vegetables and tend to the animals. Each 5-6 months, Husan takes the cows he has raised to the market for sale, while sheep are ready to be sold after 2 months. While his animal business represents his main source of income, Husan is also employed as a painter at construction sites. In his absence, his wife and children take care of the livestock.

Husan plans to use this loan to purchase livestock and animal fodder. He is grateful for the financial support from organizations such as Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cattle and animal feed

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана – из Мелитополя. Она торгует на местном рынке женской одеждой. У нее свое собственное торговое место. Опыт работы в этом бизнесе составляет уже 10 лет. 
Светлане необходима сумма в 20 000 гривен для личных целей: для того, чтобы сделать ремонт одной из комнат, ванной и туалета. Светлана надеется с помощью полученной суммы выложить кафель в ванной и туалете, установить там новую сантехнику, а также поклеить обои и положить линолеум в одной из комнат.
texts.en:
Svetlana hails from the city of Melitopol. She sells women's clothing at the local market, where she has her own retail spot. She has 10 years of experience in this line of work.

Svetlana needs a sum of 20,000 hryvnia for personal use: to carry out repairs in her home. She hopes to use this loan to lay new tile in the bathroom and in the toilet and install new fixtures there. In addition, she would like to put new wallpaper and linoleum in one of the rooms of her house.

loans.use: to carry out repairs in one room, bathroom and toilet

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana Carolina tiene 23 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo , vive con el esposo y con el hijo en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Diana Carolina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá sembrar mucho más y compraer los fertilizabtes y semillas sin ningún problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes la competencia. El sueño es comprar una casa. En los tiempos libres le gusta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina is 23 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has a son. She lives with her husband and son in Ventanas, Los Rios province. 

The DULCE SENTIMIENTO communal bank is located in the community of Caimito II, Puerto Pechiche parish, in the Pueblo Viejo canton. this bank is dedicated to short cycle agriculture, such as corn, rice and gandul beans.

Diana Carolina is a farmer and grows corn, rice and gandul beans. She sells in the Ventanas canton. She is asking for the loan to buy seeds and agricultural materials such as urea, herbicide, fertilizer and poison for weeds to keep her crops in good condition. 

The loan will be a big help because she will be able to grow a lot more and buy the fertilizer and seeds with no trouble. The challenge she faces frequently is the competition. Her dream is to buy a house. In her free time, she likes to read the bible.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural materials such as urea, herbicide, fertilizer and weed poison.

loans.name: Eloy Irineo

texts.es:
Eloy Irineo tiene 63 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con la familia y con los hijos en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Eloy Irineo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas.

 Solicita el Crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, ranger, líquido mata plagas, fertilizantes. El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá comprar los abonos, insumos y  semillas sin ningún tipo de problema.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes cómo las plagas el ratón, langosta en el maíz. El sueño es superarce y cambiar el futuro de la familia. En los tiempos libres le gusta descanzar.
texts.en:
Eloy Irineo is 63 years old. He is single and has two children. He lives with his family and two children in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. 

The DULCE SENTIMIENTO community bank is located in the community of Caimito II, parish of Puerto Pechiche, in the Pueblo Viejo canton. this bank is dedicated to short cycle agriculture such as corn, rice, and gandul beans.

Eloy Irineo is a farmer and grown corn, rice and gandul beans. He does his buying and selling in the Ventanas canton. 

He is asking for the loan to buy urea, insecticide, herbicide, liquid pesticide and fertilizer. The loan will be a big help because he will be able to buy the fertilizer, materials and seeds with no problem. 

The challenges that he faces frequently are pests such as mice and locusts in the corn. His dream is to get ahead and change his family's future. In his free time, he likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, herbicide, liquid pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años, es una persona muy responsable, feliz, solidaria, carismática y sobre todo trabajadora con deseos de superarse cada día más. Rosa vive junto a su madre en Pelileo una parroquia rural de la ciudad de Ambato. Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, le encanta el campo, ya que toda su vida ha  vivido junto a su madre y se han dedicado a las labores de la agricultura.
Rosa solicito un crédito a FODEMI para invertir en la compra semilla de maíz y en la compra de abonos naturales y fertilizantes químicos para el cuidado y tratamiento del terreno ya que nuevamente se va a sembrar y necesita mantenimiento agronómico, esta inversión ayudará Rosa a obtener mayores ganancias, lo que ayudará a mejorar la economía de su hogar. 
Rosa sueña en tener un terreno más grade donde pueda seguir sembrando hortalizas y legumbres y pueda criar ganado  para crear fuentes de trabajo y ayudar con esto a las personas que más lo necesitan y sobre todo mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old. She is a responsible, happy, supportive, charismatic and above all hardworking person who wants to get ahead more every day.   Rosa lives with her mother in Pelileo, a rural parish of the city of  Ambato. Rosa is a farmer. She lives the country, since she has lived with her mother her whole life, working in farming.

Rosa asked for a loan from FODEMI to invest in buying corn seeds and to buy natural and chemical fertilizer to care fore and treat the land. It is time to plant again and it needs agronomic maintenance. This investment will help Rosa to make more income, which will help with the household budget.  
 
Rosa dreams of having a bigger plot of land where she can keep planting vegetables and legumes and be able to raise cattle to create jobs and help people who need it the most, and above all improve the quality of life of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and natural and chemical fertilizer to care for and treat the land.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis Felipe tiene 32 años de edad de esrado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la pareja y con el hijo de 12 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

 LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Luis Felipe se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza ranger.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá invertir en la agricultura y comprar los insumos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta es el mal clima, la lancha, las plagas. El sueño es poderse esforzar para ayudarle al hijo a que culmine los estudios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y pasear con el hijo.
texts.en:
Luis Felipe is 32 years old and in a free civil union. He has one son and lives with his partner and his 12 year old son in the Ventanas canton in the province of los Ríos.

The community bank LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, can be found in Recinto Caimato II, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This is an area of agricultural laborers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Luis is a farmer who sows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys and sells in the Ventanas canton. He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and weedkiller.

The loan will be a very great help because he will be able to invest in his agriculture business and buy supplies.

The challenges he faces are the bad climate, and pests. His dream is to be able to encourage his son and help him to finish his studies. In his free time he likes to play sport and spend time with his son.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 32 years old and married to a businessman. She has been selling basic food products and other instant goods for two years. Without a doubt, her business has grown and improved her income, thereby improving her economic stability. She wants to continue selling because that is her family’s legacy and that is what they live on. She wants her business to be stable so they can survive.

Her dream is to be able to help her child. She is requesting this loan to purchase food products and instant goods in order to continue growing her business every day.

loans.use: to purchase food products and instant goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 53 years old and married with 2 children.

Nelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more spices, eggs, soft drinks, snack foods, and other items to sell.

Nelia has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 5 years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Nelia aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices, eggs, soft drinks, snack foods, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a 65-year-old married woman and a mother of 13 grown up children from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in providing "hilot" or massage service in her place. According to Wikipedia, Hilot  is an ancient Filipino art of healing, commonly used today to relax stressed muscles. Manghihilots (Hilot practitioners), also known as arbularyos, are usually cheaper alternatives to medical doctors in the Philippines, especially in very isolated rural areas.
Her husband is a farmer.

Alejandra is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and materials for her massage business like ointment and body oil. 

In the future, Alejandra hopes to improve their business especially their farming ventures to augment their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and materials for her massage business like ointment and body oil.

loans.name: Publio Beltran

texts.es:
Publio Beltrán tiene 59 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene cinco hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Publio Beltrán se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, urea, ranger, líquido mata monte, fertilizantes.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá realizar las compras sin ningún problema por el dinero.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son la competencia y las plagas. El sueño esmejorar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Publio Beltrán is 59 years old and lives with his common-law wife and 5 children in the Ventanas canton in the province of los Ríos.

The DULCE SENTIMIENTO communal bank is found in Recinto Caimito II, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank focuses on short-cycle agriculture growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Publio Beltrán works in agriculture growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys and sells in the Ventanas canton. He is asking for this loan so he can buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and weed killer.

The loan will be a very great help as he will be able to purchase these without any problems.

The challenges he faces most frequently are competition and pests. His dream is to improve his income to help his family's well-being. In his spare time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: para comprar semillas, urea, ranger, líquido mata monte, fertilizantes.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is 52 years old and is a food kiosk owner in Mombasa. She is married and she supports six in her family. She has been in this business for the past six years and she is doing well; her monthly income is great. 

This is her third loan. She will use the requested loan to purchase stock of beans, bales of wheat and maize flour and cooking fat. She will use the anticipated profits to open a food cafe. She hopes to become a landlady in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of beans, bales of wheat and maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 23 sacks of cement, 1 truckload of sand, and to pay those who work for her.

loans.name: Inga

texts.ru:
Инга – из Хуста, Западная Украина. Она занимается торговлей одеждой и другими товарами б/у, арендуя торговое место для работы. Этим бизнесом Инга занимается уже 2 года. Начинать было тяжело, так как конкуренция была серьезной. Но Инга сразу сделала ставку на более изысканный товар, который она всегда аккуратно раскладывает на столах, чтобы его можно было хорошо рассмотреть, и он лучше продавался. 
В этот раз Инге не обойтись без дополнительных финансовых средств в размере 20 000 гривен. Она планирует увеличить разнообразие товара,  закупить зимнюю одежду секонд хенд и постельное белье б/у для реализации.
texts.en:
Inga lives in Khoost in western Ukraine. She sells second-hand clothing and other goods from a rented retail location. Inga has been in this business for the past 2 years. Things were difficult in the beginning due to stiff competition. However, Inga made a bet on more refined merchandise, which she always displays attractively on her tables for the customers, and it sold well.

This time, Inga cannot do without additional funds in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia. She is planning to expand the range of her merchandise and to stock up on second-hand winter clothing and bedding for resale.

loans.use: to expand the range of her merchandise and stock up on second-hand winter clothing and bedding

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline,19, is single, and she supports her parents. She has been growing crops to sell and has kept poultry for the past two years, making a monthly income of 13,000 KES.

She has borrowed 30,000 KES to purchase chicks to rear and sell at a profit. She will also buy farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers. 

She plans to use reinvest her additional income into her business and save to educate her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to resell.

loans.name: Mirshakir

texts.en:
Mirshakir is a 33-year-old married man with one infant. He opened his own grocery store to improve his living. He has 15 years’ experience in trading business, and he hopes his skills will help him. As the store is new, it does not feature an extensive variety of goods to sell.  

Mirshakir is a hard worker, putting much effort into improving his family's social living. He hopes that the new business will run well and that he will realize his plans to expand his trading business.

loans.use: to expand the variety of the selection in his grocery store.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and other items to sell. 

Nida has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Khim Hak

texts.en: Khim Hak is 32 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a photographer who makes an income of $10 each day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Khim Hak is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a camera to use in the business. This purchase will help her generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a photographry shop and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a camera to use in her family's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cream, shampoo, weaves, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah, 36, is from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with two children aged 16 years and 12.

Juliah has a cosmetics business that she has been running for the past 12 years and has applied for her eighth loan from KADET LTD to buy more cosmetics to add to her stock.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future and be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of cosmetics.

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en:
Janerose, 56, is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and four children who are all in school.She has been in farming for the past eight years, producing milk and poultry products which she sells to people in her local market.

She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds which she will later sell to earn extra money that will help her improve her family's living standards and pay for her children's schooling. She aspires to have one thousand poultry birds in the next five years.

Pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Zone Setia Group

texts.en:
"Zone Setia" is a group of four people whose members live in the same village but have different businesses. The group's leader, Murani, who is wearing a pink shirt in the picture, is 46 years old. Murani is married to Armand. She has a child, Rizky, who is 16 years old and is in Senior High School. Murani and her husband live together with Rizky and take care of the different household responsibilities together.

Murani works as gymnastic instructor from one village to another, and she also sells gym suits and t-shirts. She started this business last year. Usually she works as a gymnastic instructor on call, and with her experience she usually gets a call at least twice a week. After she works as a instructor then she sells her goods. From this business she can get 100,000 IDR a week. From this income she can pay her child's extracurricular fees. She has dream to open a bakery because her child wants to be a chef. 

Murani is borrowing 2,000,000 IDR, she will use this loan to buy gym suits and t-shirts.

Murani and the other members of the “Zone Setia" group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the 2nd time so that they can increase their working capital.

loans.use: to buy gym suits and t-shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agrochemicals, pesticides and insecticides.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido, de 47 años, es un hombre honesto y muy amable, siempre trabajó mucho para poder brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, esta casado con Narda de 39 años y es padre de tres hijos, Melina de 16, Alexa de 11 y José de 5 años, viven juntos en la casa propia que pudo construir como resultado de su arduo trabajo y es ahí donde a diario junto a su esposa comparte la alegría de educar a sus hijos e intentar brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

La actividad de Guido, como todos los días, es de conducir mototaxi, para eso sale a las calles de la ciudad en su vehículo en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros a quienes transporta dentro y fuera de la ciudad con bastante serenidad y tranquilidad ya que considera que la seguridad de sus pasajeros es lo más importante, de la misma manera siempre brinda su numero de celular para que pueda ser contactado por algún cliente que necesita de su servicio de transporte o eventualmente como electricista, es así que pasa sus días entre las calles de la ciudad y las casas a las que acude cuando es requerido para realizar algún servicio de electricidad, su experiencia y la calidad de su trabajo lo coloca como una pieza clave en ambos oficios que desarrolla.  Eventualmente brinda servicio logístico a empresas particulares.
Lleva realizando estas actividades por 16 años y aunque al principio no le fue muy bien ahora afirma que esa situación a cambiado y sus ingresos se han visto multiplicados gracias a las recomendaciones de cada uno de los clientes para quien ya trabajó. Ahora espera continuar trabajando y más adelante implementarse con más unidades de mototaxi para empezar a alquilarlos y generar sus ingresos económicos con mayor comodidad. por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometido una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500), renovará el tapizado y algunos repuestos que su mototaxi necesita para estar en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Guido, who is 47, is an honest and very friendly man who has always worked hard to provide the best living conditions for his family.  He is married to Narda, who is 39, and is the father of three children, Melina (16), Alexa (11) and José (5). They all live together in their own home which Guido was able to build as a result of his hard work and here, along with his wife, he shares the daily joy of raising their children and trying to give them a better quality of life.  

Guido runs a motorcycle taxi business and so, every day, he drives round the city streets in search of potential passengers whom he drives within and outside the city.  He conducts himself in quite a calm and tranquil way as he believes that his passengers' safety is the most important thing.  Similarly, he always gives his mobile phone number so that he can be contacted by any client who needs his taxi service or possibly also his skills as an electrician.  Consequently, he divides his days between the city streets and the houses where he goes when he is needed to do an electrical job.  His experience and the quality of his work have made him indispensable in both of the jobs he does.  He could also provide a logistics service for private companies.  He has been involved in these businesses for 16 years and, although things did not go so well for him in the early days, he says that the situation has now changed and his income has grown significantly thanks to personal recommendations from all the customers he has worked for.  

He now hopes to continue working and, in time, equip himself with more motorcycle taxis so that he can hire them out and generate an income in an easier way.  He is, therefore, grateful to those who, by making possible his loan, will allow him to pursue his goals.  Furthermore, he is once again very determined to make his repayments on time, as he did his previous loans.  He is very happy to belong to his communal bank because all its members are very kind, friendly and supportive.  With the sum requested (S/. 1500), he will renew the motorcycle taxi’s upholstery and buy the spare parts necessary to keep it in the best possible condition.

loans.use: to renew the motorcycle taxi’s upholstery and buy the spare parts necessary to keep it in the best possible condition.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
